docs.snippet: Cappie Pondexter scored a season-high 21 points to help the Liberty end a three-game losing streak with an 81-64 victory over the visiting Washington Mystics....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cappie Pondexter scored a season-high 21 points to help the Liberty end a three-game losing streak with an 81-64 victory over the visiting Washington Mystics.
docs.abstract: New York Liberty defeat Washington Mystics, 81-64, in WNBA action.

docs.snippet: The Heat and the Spurs are prime examples of how the game has evolved after the introduction of the long-range shot....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Heat and the Spurs are prime examples of how the game has evolved after the introduction of the long-range shot.
docs.abstract: Miami Heat and San Antonio Spurs, who are playing in the NBA finals for the second consecutive year, are prime examples of how professional basketball has evolved after the introduction of the long-range shot; 3-pointer was once the domain of smaller players, but now big men are scoring from beyond the arc, ramping up pressure on defenses.

headline.main: 3-Pointer No Longer Domain of Small Players in N.B.A.
headline.print_headline: In Evolving League, Some of the Biggest Players Take the Longest Shots

docs.snippet: The air-conditioning system at AT&T Center was working Sunday night as LeBron James scored 35 points to help the Heat even the N.B.A. finals at a game apiece....
docs.lead_paragraph: The air-conditioning system at AT&T Center was working Sunday night as LeBron James scored 35 points to help the Heat even the N.B.A. finals at a game apiece.
docs.abstract: Miami Heat defeat San Antonio Spurs, 98-96, to tie NBA finals at one game apiece; Heat forward LeBron James leads all scorers with 35 points, along with 10 rebounds and 3 assists, last of which leads to 3-pointer by center Chris Bosh that puts Heat ahead to stay in fourth quarter.

headline.main: James and the Heat Coolly Even the N.B.A. Finals
headline.print_headline: James and the Heat Coolly Even the Series

headline.main: Sterling’s Ban and Fine Won’t Change, Silver Says
headline.print_headline: Sterling’s Ban and Fine Won’t Change, Silver Says

docs.snippet: The battle to give top football and basketball players a cut of the billions of dollars flowing into college athletics began in earnest with former UCLA basketball star Ed O'Bannon taking the stand in federal court to describe how he spent long ho...
docs.lead_paragraph: The battle to give top football and basketball players a cut of the billions of dollars flowing into college athletics began in earnest with former UCLA basketball star Ed O'Bannon taking the stand in federal court to describe how he spent long hours working on his game and as few as possible on his grades.

headline.main: O'Bannon Takes Stand in Landmark NCAA Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: O'Bannon Takes Stand in Landmark NCAA Lawsuit
